intro: Ranunculus brachyphyllus, commonly known as the dwarf buttercup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features delicate, palmate leaves and bright yellow flowers with five to eight petals. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters, making it a compact and ornamental species. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. The flowers bloom in early spring, adding a vibrant touch to its natural habitat.
